description: Market potential represents the total number of products that could be in use if every possible user or application adopted the technology. In other words, it reflects the maximum possible reach of a product within its market. The unit of measurement is units, representing market size.

The addressable market indicates the portion of the total market potential that can realistically be reached or served, considering current accessibility, infrastructure, and economic conditions. Like market potential, the unit of measurement is units, representing market size.

Penetration measures the extent to which the addressable market has already been reached. It is expressed as a percentage, calculated as:

Penetration (%) = Installed Base / Addressable Market x 100.

This metric shows how much of the addressable market has been realised through actual adoption.

Shipments represent the number of products purchased within a given period. Where relevant, technologies are divided into hardware, software, and service components. For example, in the case of recording and mapping technologies, a farmer may purchase:

  • Hardware (e.g. a drone)
  • Software (e.g. mapping software to process drone data)
  • Service (e.g. outsourcing mapping to a third-party provider)

Units for shipments vary by component. Hardware shipments are measured in units (each representing a purchased device), while software shipments are measured in no. of subscriptions. Shipments are calculated by dividing revenue by price.

The installed base refers to the total number of products currently in use. Depending on the technology component, this may be measured in units (for hardware) or subscriptions (for software). The installed base is calculated by summing shipments over the product's lifetime, accounting for equipment reaching end of life or software licenses that have expired. This provides an accurate picture of the technologies actively in operation.
Price refers to the average cost of the product, measured in euros (EUR).
Revenue represents the total revenue generated from product sales or subscriptions. It is measured in euros (EUR).
